name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text:
It has been an honor and a pleasure to serve at the side of a once-in-a-generation leader. America is a far better place for her service, and I am just one of the many who is grateful for her efforts.

Thank you, Madam Speaker.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: These are just a few of the transformative achievements made possible by Speaker Pelosi's leadership. Not Democratic wins, but life-changing victories for hundreds of millions of Americans. And if you want to teach kids to stand up to bullies, Nancy can teach your master class.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text:
We got both in Nancy Pelosi and have the receipts to prove it.

The Affordable Care Act, American Rescue Plan, Inflation Reduction Act, CHIP, CHIPS, halving child poverty, historic increases to veterans care, saving the auto industry, saving the economy from Depression — TWICE.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: In these turbulent times, we needed a Speaker who was both a shrewd strategist — one who could unite the most diverse caucuses ever — and a leader with the conviction to uphold the values that got Democrats elected by historic margins.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: My first month in office, I said my vote for @SpeakerPelosi was the most important I'd ever take, and 16 years later I've been proven right. She was a trailblazer — first woman Speaker, first to be elected Speaker twice. But she'll be remembered for so much more.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: It’s about time our tax code worked in favor of working families. The #ChildTaxCredit will put money in parents' pockets to cover childcare, put gas in the car to get to work, or replenish savings accounts that so many were forced to dip into during the pandemic. Help is here. https://t.co/stiVFGyHsD

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text:
This one change will help lift half of our nation’s children out of poverty.

146,000+ Louisville families will benefit. An estimated 929,000 families statewide will get $.

This idea has long been talked about to help families, but the #AmericanRescuePlan will make it a reality. https://t.co/pYnSYigWAW

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text:
Eligible families can get up to $300/mo. per child for children age 0 to 5, or $250/mo. per child for children age 6 to 17.

Families qualify for a full credit if their income is below $112K for individuals filing as head of household or $150K for those married or filing jointly. https://t.co/uRajgDqVus

Many who voted for this holiday want to ban teaching the facts of America’s history with racism and are deliberately perpetuating systemic discrimination.

The #Juneteenth holiday is a great thing. But it is far from enough. We have so much work ahead.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text:
Proud to have worked with my colleagues and @POTUS, standing on the shoulders of giants like Opal Lee, to make #Juneteenth a holiday. Acknowledging past injustices and victories is crucial.

But let’s be honest. It won’t mean much if we don’t address injustice going forward.

H.R. 1 will enhance voting rights, crack down on corruption, help restore a basic standard of ethics in government, and make our elections more secure.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: H.R. 1 will prevent Members of Congress from serving on corporate boards and require Presidents of the United States to disclose their tax returns.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: H.R. 1 will root out dark money in politics, strengthen disclosure laws on political ads, tighten rules on so-called “Super PACs,” and restructure the Federal Elections Commission to end the gridlock and enhance its enforcement mechanisms.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: H.R. 1 will help restore the Voting Rights Act, give full congressional voting rights to the District of Columbia, prohibit voter roll purges like those seen in Ohio, Georgia, and elsewhere, and END partisan gerrymandering to prevent politicians from picking their voters.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: H.R. 1 will create automatic voter registration, expand early voting & enhance absentee voting, simplify vote by mail, reduce long lines & wait times at polls, ensure that individuals who've completed felony sentences have full voting rights restored, and modernize our elections.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: Last week’s attack on the Capitol, how I’m processing it, and where we go from here: https://t.co/CpnHrUxnAF

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: I vote to impeach the President because it is the right thing to do. And it’s time for that to mean something again.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: I do so because, last week, Donald Trump committed the most heinous act ever committed by a U.S. President, and I am one of 535 people charged with holding him accountable.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: I do so because I, like the President, swore an oath to "support and defend the Constitution of the United States against all enemies, foreign and domestic… and to faithfully discharge the duties of the office,"but unlike the President, I intend to honor it.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: For the second time, I will vote to impeach the President knowing that it is unlikely he will be removed from office before the end of his term.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: Six people died as a result of his insurrection last week, many were injured and far more remain traumatized whether they were here at the Capitol that day or watched from afar.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: For four years, this President has disgraced his office, trampled rights, ruined lives, and fueled the flames of bigotry and hate.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: It is an understatement to say that history will not look kindly on this President. But history will also harshly judge a Congress that failed to stop him and a Republican Party that allowed him to evade the law and believe himself a dictator.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: And yet, while this dark episode was unprecedented, it was entirely consistent with the behavior he has displayed each day for well over the last four years.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: Never in American history has a President taken such brazen, lawless, and reckless action against our own nation as Donald Trump undertook last week.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text:
Tonight, I will vote in favor of a resolution urging @VP Pence to invoke the 25th Amendment to save us from the threat of Donald Trump. If he fails to act, Democrats and Republicans in the House will join together to again vote to Impeach this President.

Country over party.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: Proud Father https://t.co/RqSNDn8UMx

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: As a former newspaper owner and editor, I wholeheartedly agree. A free press is a fundamental pillar of our nation's democracy. I want to thank every member of the Capitol Hill press corps who risked their safety to tell the world what was happening amidst the chaos. https://t.co/psVUsM8HPZ

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: But not everyone made it home safely that day. U.S. Capitol Police Officer Brian Sicknick’s life was tragically stolen from him while protecting our nation and our democracy. Those responsible for his death must be brought to justice.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: Back home in Louisville and I just want to offer my thanks to everyone who called, texted, or emailed checking in on me and my staff hoping we were safe during Wednesday’s horrific attack on our Capitol. I am eternally grateful to have such kind and caring constituents & friends.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: I know it’s been said and should go without saying, but it can’t be said enough. If police met a Black mob breaking windows at the Capitol, we’d still be cleaning up blood today.

Nixon resigned because his party refused to stand by his corruption. 

Trump leaves office with most Republicans in Congress not only supporting him despite his crimes but trying to keep him in power illegally.

It’s the difference between a corrupt president and a corrupt party.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: This is a devastating loss for me, but also for our community. I am heartened that Sonny's legacy will continue to touch lives and enrich generations to come. My deepest sympathies to Gladys, Steve, and the Bass family. I join you in mourning and celebrating a truly great man.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: So many will cherish every moment they had with Sonny, whether just a laugh, word of wisdom, bit of magic, or tiny toy he had at the ready to dazzle young or old. The mark he left on all he encountered was always bright, indelible, and made us feel good about ourselves.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: Many know Sonny and his wonderful wife Gladys for their tremendous generosity to the University of Louisville and community organizations. And that would be enough. Their support facilitates countless good works and improves more lives than we can count. But it's just one part.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: I am heartbroken by the loss of Sonny Bass. For as long as I can remember, Sonny has been a dear friend, first to my father and then to me. I have always been able to count on him for support, kindness, advice, and unbridled honesty.

• Support strong unemployment benefits
• Protect our frontline health workers
• Expand food security programs

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: Today, we honor those who have sacrificed their sweat and blood so we may all live free, and we vow to be there for our veterans and active duty service members when THEY need US, not just when we need them.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: We’re blessed to live in the greatest and most free country in the world, but that freedom has a cost. We must honor the sacrifices of our veterans by fighting back when anyone, foreign or domestic, threatens the freedoms they defended.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: Our veterans shouldn’t have to fight to get quality health care, job training, a roof over their head, or an education they are owed. They and their families shouldn’t have to fight to find adequate mental health services for PTSD and the other less visible wounds of war.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: As we join together in thanks and appreciation of the brave men and women who’ve fought around the world to protect this nation today, let’s also commit to ensuring they won’t have to struggle here at home to build a strong future.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: This budget and the tax cuts that will follow fail the American people on all fronts.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: The American people deserve a budget that invests in their future, a tax code that is fair, and a full and honest debate on both.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: The GOP is rushing their tax plan to the floor because they don’t want you to know what's in it.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: The fight now shifts to the GOP tax plan that will be brought to the House floor in just a matter of weeks.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text:
Medicare.
Medicaid.
Social Security.
Nutrition assistance.

Vital services and benefits for American families will ALL be at risk.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: Once the tax cuts blow a huge hole in the budget, new attacks on programs that help Americans get by and get ahead will soon follow.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text:
These tax cuts will INCREASE our debt and deficits by $1.5 trillion.

That's $1,500,000,000,000.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: It includes trillions of $ in tax cuts that benefit the wealthy & corporations, while increasing taxes on millions of middle class families.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: It cuts Medicare and Medicaid by nearly $2 trillion.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text: It cuts critical national priorities by more than $5 trillion. Education, health care, research, and infrastructure are ALL threatened.

name: Rep. John Yarmuth
tweet_text:
Congress just approved a shockingly extreme budget.

Here's what you need to know:
